author: Robert Bellafiore Jr.
title: Millennials Hit the Great Books
text:
Norman, Okla.
‘This is the hardest class you will ever take,” one of my University of Oklahoma professors warned. I eagerly enrolled in the course, “Fate and the Individual in European Literature.” Taught by three professors using a syllabus developed by the poet W.H. Auden, it promised to cover, over two semesters and 6,000 pages, 34 of the greatest works in the canon, from Homer to Derek Walcott.
The...
